record.name: hit
record.description: When true, indicates that the request was satisfied by the cache; that is, it was not forwarded, and the response was obtained from the cache.

record.name: fwd
record.description: When present, indicates that the request went forward towards the origin; its value indicates why.

record.name: fwd-status
record.description: Indicates which status code (see , Section 15) the next-hop server returned in response to the forwarded request.

record.name: ttl
record.description: Indicates the responseâ€™s remaining freshness lifetime (see , Section 4.2.1) as calculated by the cache, as an integer number of seconds, measured as closely as possible to when the response header section is sent by the cache.

record.name: stored
record.description: Indicates whether the cache stored the response (see , Section 3); a true value indicates that it did.

record.name: collapsed
record.description: Indicates whether this request was collapsed together with one or more other forward requests (see , Section 4); If true, the response was successfully reused; if not, a new request had to be made.

record.name: key
record.description: Conveys a representation of the cache key (see , Section 2) used for the response.

record.name: detail
record.description: Allows implementations to convey additional information not captured in other parameters, such as implementation-specific states or other caching-related metrics.
